\begin{document}


\title{Protection provided by covid-19 vaccines and previous infection against the Omicron variant}

\author{Supplementary Material 2 -- Results of Statistical Estimation}

\date{February 26, 2022, revised September 1, 2022}

\maketitle

This material contains results of the analyses by Cox Regression (1--14,20) and by Logistic Regression (15--19).

\paragraph*{Cox Regression} The report from a Cox Regression contains a forest plot and a descriptive statistic of involved covariates. The forest plot displays the estimates of the hazard rates corresponding to individual categories of the covariates and their confidence intervals. Below each category name, the number N of input records containing the category is displayed. For each covariate other than AgeGr and Sex, there is a table of categories with the number of subjects from the Institute of Health Information and Statistics database finding themselves in the category at time zero (column Entered) and the number of individuals, suffering the outcome while being in the category (column Events).\footnote{It can happen that the Entered value is less than the Events one. For instance, as boosters started to be administrated as late as in October 21, only a small number found themselves in the category {$\tt boost2+\_alone$} at the beginning of the study. At the end of the period, on the other hand, there were more than one million people in the category (more than 61 days from the booster), so the number of event could be higher.}

\paragraph*{Logistic Regression} The results of logistic Regressions include forest plots of individual covariates and, in particular, the odds ratios of the Omicron and the Delta variant (row Variant).

\newpage



\coxresult{IOmicronInteractions}{Infections -- Omicron}

\coxresult{IDeltaInteractions}{Infections -- Delta}

\coxresultinf{ROmicron}{Protection by Infection -- Omicron}

\coxresultinf{RDelta}{Protection by Infection -- Delta}


\coxresult{HOmicronInteractions}{Hospitalizations -- Omicron}

\coxresult{HDeltaInteractions}{Hospitalizations -- Delta}

\coxresult{OOmicronInteractions}{Oxygen therapy -- Omicron}

\coxresult{ODeltaInteractions}{Oxygen therapy -- Delta}

\coxresult{UOmicronInteractions}{ICU therapy -- Omicron}

\coxresult{UDeltaInteractions}{ICU therapy -- Delta}

\coxresultiv{IDeltaDetail}{Infections by Vaccines - Delta}

\coxresultiv{HOmicronDetail}{Hospitalizations by Vaccines - Omicron}

\coxresultiv{HDeltaDetail}{Hospitalizations by Vaccines - Delta}

\logregresult{logreg_HInteractions}{Hospitalizaton given Infection}

\logregresult{logreg_OInteractions}{Oxygen given Infection}

\logregresult{logreg_IPInteractions}{ICU given Infection}

\logregresult{logreg_HospOInteractions}{Oxygen given Hospitalization}

\logregresult{logreg_HospIPInteractions}{ICU given Hospitalization}

\coxresult{IOmicronInteractionsSensitivity}{Infections -- Omicron -- Sensitivity$^*$}
{$^*$ The same analysis as in Section 1, but with rare categories grouped to "other" category rather than omitted.}
